A player beheads Elvarg

Elvarg is the dragon that players have to kill in the Dragon Slayer I quest. She resides in the dungeon below Crandor. She is a green dragon, and is considerably stronger than the usual kind. Unlike other chromatic dragons, Elvarg has a ranged dragonfire attack. Despite being a dragon, she is not vulnerable to dragonbane weapons.

Elvarg can be fought in the Nightmare Zone after the quest is completed. An anti-dragon shield is provided in the arena. Unlike her quest version, this version will only use dragonfire to attack, will always drop dragon bones, and will lower stats if you have insufficient dragonfire protection. The dragonfire max damage only depends on your dragonfire protection (prayer, potion, and shield). Both the normal and hard Elvarg will have the same max damage depending on which combination of dragonfire protection you're using. The super antifire potion (including the extended and mix versions) by itself is enough to prevent all damage (even without an anti-dragon shield).

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Crandor and Karamja Dungeon831Maplink

History[edit | edit source]

During the Dragonkin Conflicts, the Dragonkin needed to defend themselves from humans, who refused to distinguish peaceful and aggressive dragonkin. Zorgoth and other unnamed Dragonkin worked on creating dragons with increased aggression. The first of these experiments took place underneath Crandor, where they successfully created a green dragon with heightened aggression: Elvarg. Eventually, she was abandoned by her creators, making her home in the underground system underneath the island.

Remains of the original adventurer who woke Elvarg

Elvarg went into a deep slumber, until the year 139 of the Fifth Age when a Crandorian adventurer discovered the cave system and explored the area, eventually stumbling into Elvarg's chamber. The adventurer roused her from her sleep, and she torched them in retaliation before leaving the caverns and torched Crandor completely, its inhabitants not having any sort of dragonfire protection to fight back. Crandorian survivors made a small camp near Rimmington, but Elvarg pursued them and killed most of the survivors, with only three mages able to escape; Melzar, Lozar and Thalzar, each of whom split a map to the island and went their separate ways. The human kingdoms of Misthalin were on high alert, worried she might devastate the continent, but fortunately she returned to her chamber on the island.

During the year 169 of the Fifth Age, an adventurer who entered the Champions' Guild looked for a quest; the Guildmaster told them to speak to Oziach, who in turn told them to slay Elvarg. The adventurer acquired equipment, including an anti-dragon shield from Duke Horacio, and the map from the three mages (two of which had died, while the other went insane), a ship, and a captain who was not intimidated by her reputation. They soon came upon the chamber where Elvarg was, and successfully slew her after a grueling battle, ripping her head off as proof of her demise.

Strategy & tips[edit | edit source]

When planning to vanquish Elvarg, see the sections on the Dragon Slayer I page about preparing and tips and strategies.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Elvarg was confirmed to be female in the 16th Postbag from the Hedge, by such quotes as "She wouldn't 'a had second thoughts about roasting yer with her breath‚Ä¶" and "That's what she done to Crandor, after all‚Ä¶"

She resides in the [[Crandor and Karamja Dungeon|dungeon]] below [[Crandor]]. She is a [[green dragon]], and is considerably stronger than the usual kind. Unlike other [[chromatic dragons]], Elvarg has a ''ranged'' [[dragonfire]] attack. Despite being a dragon, she is not vulnerable to [[dragonbane weapons]]. Elvarg can be fought in the [[Nightmare Zone]] after the quest is completed. An [[anti-dragon shield]] is provided in the arena. Unlike her quest version, this version will only use [[dragonfire]] to attack, will always drop [[dragon bones]], and will lower stats if you have insufficient [[dragonfire]] protection. The [[dragonfire]] max damage only depends on your [[Dragonfire#Protection|dragonfire protection]] (prayer, potion, and shield). Both the normal and hard Elvarg will have the same max damage depending on which combination of [[Dragonfire#Protection|dragonfire protection]] you're using. The [[super antifire potion]] (including the [[Extended super antifire|extended]] and [[Super antifire mix|mix]] versions) by itself is enough to prevent all damage (even without an [[anti-dragon shield]]). {{Clear|left}} ==Location== {{LocTableHead}} {{LocLine |name = Elvarg |location = [[Crandor and Karamja Dungeon]] |levels = 83 |members = No |mapID = 9 |plane = 0 |x:2852,y:9637 |mtype = pin }} {{LocTableBottom}} ==History== During the [[Dragonkin Conflicts]], the [[Dragonkin]] needed to defend themselves from humans, who refused to distinguish peaceful and aggressive dragonkin. [[Zorgoth]] and other unnamed Dragonkin worked on creating [[dragon (race)|dragons]] with increased aggression. The first of these experiments took place underneath [[Crandor]], where they successfully created a green dragon with heightened aggression: Elvarg. Eventually, she was abandoned by her creators, making her home in the underground system underneath the island. [[File:Elvarg adventurer.png|thumb|left|Remains of the original adventurer who woke Elvarg]] Elvarg went into a deep slumber, until the year 139 of the [[Fifth Age]] when a Crandorian adventurer discovered the cave system and explored the area, eventually stumbling into Elvarg's chamber. The adventurer roused her from her sleep, and she torched them in retaliation before leaving the caverns and torched Crandor completely, its inhabitants not having any sort of dragonfire protection to fight back. Crandorian survivors made a small camp near [[Rimmington]], but Elvarg pursued them and killed most of the survivors, with only three mages able to escape; [[Melzar]], [[Lozar]] and [[Thalzar]], each of whom split a map to the island and went their separate ways. The human kingdoms of [[Misthalin]] were on high alert, worried she might devastate the continent, but fortunately she returned to her chamber on the island. During the year 169 of the Fifth Age, an adventurer who entered the [[Champions' Guild]] looked for a quest; the [[Guildmaster]] told them to speak to [[Oziach]], who in turn told them to slay Elvarg. The adventurer acquired equipment, including an [[anti-dragon shield]] from [[Duke Horacio]], and the map from the three mages (two of which had died, while the other went insane), a ship, and a captain who was not intimidated by her reputation. They soon came upon the chamber where Elvarg was, and successfully slew her after a grueling battle, ripping her head off as proof of her demise. {{Clear|left}} ==Strategy & tips== When planning to vanquish Elvarg, see the sections on the [[Dragon Slayer I]] page about [[Dragon_Slayer_I#Preparing_for_the_fight|preparing]] and [[Dragon_Slayer_I#Tips_for_the_fight_&_potential_strategies|tips and strategies]]. {{Clear|left}} ==Drops== ===100%=== {{DropsTableHead}} {{DropsLine|name=Dragon bones|quantity=1|rarity=Always|raritynotes=Only in [[Nightmare Zone]]}} {{DropsTableBottom}} {{Reflist|group=d}} ==Changes== ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Elvarg (historical).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Elvarg.png|center|300x150px]] |- |29 March 2004 ‚Äì
